content: Noah Chrein has organized an ACT seminar at the University of Maryland, Thursdays, 2pm EST. This week's speaker is Mike Rawson who will tell us about some methods in persistence homology. The Zoom meeting id is 444 685 053. I'll post a link once I get one.
The future is nonstop virtual CT seminars. The future is now.

Thanks for posting the link Blake!

FYI the meetings will be recorded, I'll post the videos when they're up!
For any of you using chromeOS, Zoom's local recording option won't recognize your cloud drive natively. You will lose your recording :/

Luckily Mike has talk notes, I've posted them up here:
https://mdcats.github.io/assets/docs/Mike_Rawson_March_26.pdf
Here's a better link for seminar info, including videos and schedules: mdcats.github.io
